poem:
"Play of Shadows Unseen"

Under the marquee lights, reality dances,
Performance mirrors truth - naked, harsh.
In each sleeping gasp, a memory is stirred,
Awakening bruised flowers within a dare.
Bitter elixir poised upon ruby lips, devoured in trust -
A stage set for uninvited intimacy,
Echoes of a crime sung as melody.
Seeking catharsis in our common darkest night.
So much depends upon the awakeners, silent in their seats.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Rising festival 2024: theatre-maker to be drugged unconscious in ‘deeply unnerving’ show about date rape A theatremaker will be drugged unconscious on stage in Melbourne this year, in a controversial and highly lauded theatre work about sexual violence that will have its Australian premiere at Rising festival. Cadela Força Trilogy: The Bride and the Goodnight Cinderella is directed by and stars Brazilian artist Carolina Bianchi, who recounts her experience of being drugged and sexually assaulted,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
